main event: S/Sgt Martin K. Boone observed an unidentified aerial phenomenon while traveling near Tularosa, New Mexico on 20 February 1950.
interesting points: The sighting occurred at approximately 0630 hrs MST and lasted for about 5 minutes, The object was described as a bright white round light with a size approximately that of a half dollar held at arm's length, The object did not appear to move and was about 10 miles east of the observer's position, Weather conditions were overcast, but visibility was good, No local flights or testing devices were reported in the area at the time.
witness description: S/Sgt Martin K. Boone, an Air Police Officer, and Cpl. Robert B. Reisig, both from Holloman AFB
